title: Rear Brake Master Cylinder - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Notice - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork.
Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Rear Master Cylinder Install DR5 DS5
Fit the rear brake master cylinder to the right hand control plate and tighten the fixings to
Position the brake pedal to the pushrod, engage the clevis and retain it with the clip. Make sure the clip is fitted as shown below:
Refit the brake fluid reservoir and its hose to the master cylinder as noted during removal. Secure with the clip.
Put the right hand control plate in position on the frame. Install and torque the top fixing to
Install and torque the control plate bottom fixing to
Incorporating new washers to either side of the union, fit the brake line. Tighten the union bolt to
Put the right hand heel guard in position. Install and torque the heel guard fixings to
Bleed the Rear Brakes DR5 DS5
Check the operation of the brake and carry out a thorough leak check before riding the motorcycle.
Front Sprocket Cover Installation DP5; DR5; DS5

It is dangerous to operate the motorcycle with defective brakes; you must have your authorised Triumph dealer take remedial action before you attempt to ride the motorcycle again. Failure to take remedial action may reduce braking efficiency leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Check the operation of the rear brake. Rectify as necessary.

Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.

Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Fixings
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Tightening Procedures
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork.
Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Fit the rear brake master cylinder to the right hand control plate and tighten the fixings to
16 Nm
Position the brake pedal to the pushrod, engage the clevis and retain it with the clip. Make sure the clip is fitted as shown below:
Clip
Clevis pin
Fixings
Master cylinder
Refit the brake fluid reservoir and its hose to the master cylinder as noted during removal. Secure with the clip.
Put the right hand control plate in position on the frame. Install and torque the top fixing to
25 Nm
Install and torque the control plate bottom fixing to
40 Nm
Incorporating new washers to either side of the union, fit the brake line. Tighten the union bolt to
25 Nm
Put the right hand heel guard in position. Install and torque the heel guard fixings to
6 Nm
Perform the following operations:
Bleed the rear brake (see
Bleeding the Rear Brakes
Check the operation of the brake and carry out a thorough leak check before riding the motorcycle.

Battery - Installation
Seat - Installation

Check the operation of the rear brake. Rectify as necessary.
